title: What country music singer has the most hokey songs? - Quora

response.answer_text: I’m a huge fan of Hank Williams. His songs tell a tragic tale of his life. His honest delivery and raw emotion can make the listener feel his pain. And then, their are some Hank songs where the emotion is real but not sad. “Settin’ the Woods on Fire” is a great example where the listener can feel the honest joy and anticipation of a hot date later that evening. But then, sometimes even Ted Williams would strike out. So did Hank. If you want pure, unadulterated hokey, then this song is for you.

Hokey: mawkish, sentimental and contrived, originated in the 1940’s from ‘Hokum’ There’s an entire sub-genre. It’s called ‘Bro-Country’. Jason Aldean, Luke Bryan and Florida Georgia Line are some of clear examples of the type. Bro-country is mawkish and sentimental (for old high school football players gone to seed) and completely contrived. It doesn’t call back to the past unless it’s rose-shifted. It doesn't learn from rock (like Corb Lund) or hardcore (like John Moreland). It’s not even an interesting melding (like Gangstagrass)
